summary: The BMW M328 engine, produced from 1936 to 1940, features an aluminium cross-flow cylinder head with hemispherical combustion chambers and is a straight-six configuration with a displacement of 2.0 L (1,971 cc). It has a cylinder bore of 66 mm and a piston stroke of 96 mm. The engine was used in the BMW 328 and BMW 327/28 coupes and was later licensed to Bristol Cars in the UK. It succeeded the BMW M78 engine and was followed by the BMW M335.
